p: These data provide scientific justification for the ethnomedicinal uses of the leaves, as the inhibited bacteria are the main causative agents of the ailments the leaves are used to treat. S. aureus, E. coli, and K. pneumoniae were inhibited by a final concentration of 250 μg·mL −1 by alkaloids such as crinine, cherylline, crinamidine, 3-O-acetylhamayne, and bulbispermine which have been isolated from C. macowanii leaves [ 64]. To the best of our knowledge, this study is the first to report on the extraction of crude extract from leaves of C. macowanii and its antibacterial activity.
